thread.title: Arsenal news: Shkodran Mustafi not great yet, says Martin Keown | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Shkodran Mustafi not great yet, says Martin Keown | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Shkodran Mustafi not great yet, says Martin Keown | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 5:00 pm Shkodran Mustafi joined Arsenal from Valencia in the summer (Picture: Getty) 
Former Arsenal star Martin Keown believes Shkodran Mustafi has not proven himself in the Premier League just yet, despite a strong start. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
The Germany international has quickly become a popular figure at the Emirates Stadium since his summer arrival from Valencia, but had a bit of a shocker for the Gunners as they lost 5-1 to Bayern Munich last week. 
Keown hasn’t completely bought into all the Mustafi hype, saying that it is too soon to judge him and that he has a long way to go to live up to the standards set by his defensive partner Laurent Koscielny. Mustafi cost the Gunners around £35million (Picture: Getty) 
They (Mustafi and Koscielny) have looked good in the main,’ Keown told the Daily Mail . 
‘Mustafi got caught out against Bayern Munich. There’s no shame in being caught out, but it’s fine lines that takes you from good to great. 
‘Koscielny has proven he is a top talent – he just needs the trophies.
